IRS990.Description: RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS - RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS EMPHASIZE RECOVERY AND SELF-DETERMINATION IN ALL ASPECTS OF LIFE FOR ADULTS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS. GROUP HOMES PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SUPPORTS AND EDUCATION TO ADULT MEN AND WOMEN RETURNING TO LIFE IN THE COMMUNITY. RESIDENTS LIVE IN A HOMELIFE ATMOSPHERE AND LEARN ABOUT BUDGETING, COOKING, CLEANING, AND COMMUNICATION, AS WELL AS HOW TO COPE WITH THEIR ILLNESS.

Activity2.Description: COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICES - SERVICES ASSIST CONSUMERS IN DEFINING AND ACHIEVING THEIR PERSONAL RECOVERY GOALS AND ENCOURAGE INDEPENDENCE AND SELF-DETERMINATION. THEY INCLUDE LIFE-SKILLS TRAINING, CARE MANAGEMENT, PSYCHOEDUCATIONAL GROUPS, AND COUNSELING. CONSUMERS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS SOMETIMES NEED ENCOURAGEMENT TO ENGAGE IN TREATMENT. PROVIDES OUTREACH AND LINKAGE TO ADULTS WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED A PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITALIZATION; PRE-VOCATIONAL AND EMPLOYMENT ASSESSMENT SERVICES; MENTAL HEALTH COURT COMMUNITY SUPERVISION; AND GERIATRIC CARE MANAGEMENT. THE GOAL IS TO PROMOTE THE BEST POSSIBLE INDIVIDUAL OUTCOMES AND PREVENT HOSPITALIZATION.

Activity3.Description: PSYCHIATRIC AND MEDICAL SERVICES - BOARD-CERTIFIED PSYCHIATRISTS AND TRAINED NURSES PROVIDE MEDICATION ASSESSMENT AND PSYCHIATRIC EVALUATION, MEDICATION ADMINISTRATION AND EDUCATION ABOUT MEDICATIONS AND THEIR USE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XI, Line 8: Other Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: CASEWORKERS DETERMINE IF A PERSON IS BOTH IN NEED AND ELIGIBLE FOR ASSISTANCE. THE CASEWORKER WILL THEN FILL OUT A "CLIENT ASSISTANCE REQUEST" FORM, WHICH MUST BE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY BOTH THE CLINICAL DIRECTOR OF THE PROGRAM AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. TO ENSURE THAT THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED IS USED AS INTENDED, A CASEWORKER ACCOMPANIES THE INDIVIDUAL AND PAYS FOR THE ITEMS (FOOD, MEDICATION, SHELTER, CLOTHING, ETC.). CASH IS NEVER PHYSICALLY GIVEN TO AN ASSISTANCE RECIPIENT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All governing documents, ploicies and financial statements are made available for review upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Community Counseling Center contracted with an outside entity to establish a salary schedule based on skills, competencies, responsibilities and industry norms. Each year, jobs are reviewed to determine if any changes are needed as to how positions are classified. As part of this review, comparable industry salary data is reviewed. For the Executive Director and top management, proposed changes are reviewed with the Personnel Committee of the Board of Directors. The Finance Committee reviews all proposed salary increases for all employees and recommends annual increases each year. The full Board of Directors approves the changes as part of the annual budget approval process. For the Executive Director, comparable salary data is gathered using GuideStar. This data is reviewed by the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors and the full Board of Directors approves all salary increases for the Executive Director. The officers of the organization are volunteer members of the Board of Directors and do not receive compensation. All salary changes are recorded on a salary order form which includes the rationale for the increase and a signature of the Executive Director for employees and the Board President for the Executive Director.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A form as well as list of current vendors is given to each Board member on an annual basis in June to disclose any potential conflicts of interest. They are kept on file. If during subsequent board meetings a discussion occurs where a conflict of interest is identified, the board member must excuse themselves and leave the board room while the discussion and/or decision is made.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COPIES OF THE FORM 990 WERE EMAILED TO BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO SUBMISSION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: SUPPORTIVE PERMANENT HOUSING - A PROGRAM FOR 12 ADULTS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS WHO ARE HOMELESS. IT PROVIDES PERMANENT HOUSING COMBINED WITH ON-SITE SERVICES TO DEVELOP INDEPENDENCE, INCOME, AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES - ONE OF ONLY TWO MEDICATION-ASSISTED RECOVERY PROGRAMS FOR OPIOID ADDICTION IN SOUTHERN ILLINOIS. PARTICIPANTS ARE LESS LIKELY TO PARTICIPATE IN HARMFUL OR ILLEGAL BEHAVIORS, AND MORE LIKELY TO ENGAGE IN A RECOVERING LIFESTYLE THAT INCLUDES KEEPING A JOB, BEING A RESPONSIBLE SPOUSE OR PARENT, AND NOT BEING INVOLVED WITH THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 6: SCREENING, ASSESSMENT AND SUPPORT SERVICES (SASS): SCREENING AND ASSESSMENT SERVICES FOR ANY MADISON COUNTY CHILD AT RISK OF A PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITALIZATION. SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO THE FAMILY AND CHILD IN THEIR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT SUCH AS HOME, SCHOOL, DAYCARE, OR OTHER COMMUNITY SETTING. STAFF SUPPORTS PARENTS IN LEARNING THE MENTAL HEALTH SYSTEM AND ACCESSING RESOURCES TO HELP THE FAMILY CONTINUE ALONG THE POSITIVE ROAD TO RECOVERY. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 7: CRISIS AND ASSESSMENT SERVICES - THERE ARE TIMES WHEN PEOPLE EXPERIENCE A SEVERE EMOTIONAL REACTION OR A MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS. SOME PROBLEMS REPRESENT AND EMERGENCY AND REQUIRE AN IMMEDIATE INTERVENTION AND STABILIZATION. PROVIDES 24-HOUR CRISIS INTERVENTION, SUICIDE PREVENTION, REFERRAL, AND LINKAGE TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 8: COUNSELING SERVICES - IN COUNSELING, PEOPLE LEARN HOW TO UNDERSTAND THEIR FEELINGS AND PROBLEMS, AND HOW TO DEAL WITH THEM IN EVERY DAY LIFE. PROVIDES GROUP AND INDIVIDUAL COUNSELING FOR ADULTS, CHILDREN, AND FAMILIES EXPERIENCING LIFE'S DIFFICULTIES. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 9: EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES - CCC IS ONE OF FIVE AGENCIES SELECTED IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS TO DEVELOP A MODEL PROGRAM OF MENTAL HEALTH EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES. THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO IDENTIFY CHILDREN AT RISK OF MENTAL HEALTH CONCERNS BEFORE THEY ESCALATE TO THE CRISIS POINT. CHILDREN MAY BE EXPERIENCING AGGRESSION, SHORT TEMPERS, IMPULSIVE BEHAVIORS, ANXIETY, AND DISRUPTION TO THEIR NORMAL SLEEPING AND EATING PATTERNS. SERVICES ARE FREE OF CHARGE, AND ARE AIMED AT CHILDREN AGE THREE THROUGH TEN IN SPECIFIC COMMUNITIES. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 10: CHILD AND ADOLESCENT COMMUNITY SUPPORT - COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES FOR PARENTS AND CHILDREN THAT ARE PROVIDED IN NATURAL SETTINGS TO HELP FAMILIES IN CRISIS STRENGTHEN THEIR SKILLS AND SUPPORTS. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 11: SENIOR AND CAREGIVER SERVICES - SENIORS FACE OVERWHELMING CHALLENGES EVERY DAY - GRIEF, LOSS OF INDEPENDENCE, LOSS OF FRIENDS, DEPRESSION, AND MEDICAL PROBLEMS. COPING WITH THESE ISSUES CAN BE OVERWHELMING. THE EXPERIENCED PROFESSIONALS OF CCC ARE SPECIALLY TRAINED TO HELP INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO GET THE HELP THEY NEED. SERVICES INCLUDE ASSESSMENT, LINKAGE TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES, CARE MANAGEMENT, COUNSELING, AND EDUCATION FOR ADULTS AGE 60 AND OVER AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 12: REGIONAL FAMILY LEADERSHIP INITIATIVE - A REGIONAL INITIATIVE TO HELP FAMILIES IN THE 33 SOUTHERN ILLINOIS COUNTIES TO BECOME EMPOWERED TO ADVOCATE ON BEHALF OF THEIR CHILD'S SERVICE NEEDS. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 13: ALTON MIDDLE SCHOOL - SCHOOL BASED COUNSELING AND INTERVENTION SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AT RISK OF SERIOUS EMOTIONAL DISTURBANCES PROVIDED ON-SITE AT THE ALTON MIDDLE SCHOOL. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 14: GERIATRIC CARE SERVICES (65+) - COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN NATURAL SETTINGS FOR FRAIL ELDERLY WITH MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. THE GOAL IS TO ALLOW THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 15: MENTAL HEALTH COURT - A JAIL DIVERSION PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES COMMUNITY SUPPORT AND LIFE SKILL SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN MADISON COUNTY MENTAL HEALTH COURT. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 16: LEVEL 1 SUBSTANCE ABUSE - OUTPATIENT SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS STRUGGLING WITH SUBSTANCE USE. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 17: FLEXCARE - DUI TREATMENT SERVICES AND DOT APPROVED BACK-TO-WORK SUBSTANCE ABUSE ASSESSMENTS, AND OUTPATIENT COUNSELING SERVICES FOR ADULTS COPING WITH MENTAL ILLNESS CO-OCCURING WITH SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR DEPENDENCE.
